best_practices: Always use lock files for reproducible production deployments
Separate development and production dependencies using optional-dependencies
Pin Python version in pyproject.toml to avoid compatibility issues
anti_patterns: Using pip instead of uv for slower installs
Committing generated pycache or venv directories
Using loose version constraints without lock files in production

faq.question: Is uv faster than pip?
faq.answer: Yes, uv is 10-100x faster than pip for package installation.

faq.question: Can I use uv with existing pip requirements.txt files?
faq.answer: Yes, uv pip install -r requirements.txt works directly with pip requirements files.

faq.question: Does uv work on Windows?
faq.answer: Yes, uv supports Windows, macOS, and Linux operating systems.

faq.question: Are uv environments compatible with VSCode?
faq.answer: Yes, point VSCode Python interpreter to .venv/Scripts/python.exe on Windows or .venv/bin/python on Unix.

faq.question: How do I update packages with uv?
faq.answer: Use uv pip compile with --upgrade flag to update all packages to latest compatible versions.
